  "article_text": [
    "there are various ways to study the pairs of @xmath0 matrices @xmath1 and @xmath2 over a field @xmath3 that commute under matrix multiplication .",
    "linear algebraically , one can ask for criteria to determine commutativity .",
    "algebro - geometrically , one can study the _",
    "commuting variety _ , which is generated by the @xmath4 equations @xmath5 .",
    "these perspectives and many other variants have been studied in the classical setting @xcite .",
    "this paper considers similar questions for tropical and tropicalized matrices .",
    "the tropical min - plus algebra @xmath6 is defined by @xmath7 , @xmath8 , @xmath9 . a pair of @xmath10 tropical matrices @xmath11 , @xmath12 commute if @xmath13 , where matrix multiplication takes place in the min - plus algebra .",
    "explicitly , this means that for all @xmath14 , @xmath15    tropical linear algebra has extensive applications to discrete events systems @xcite , scheduling @xcite , pairwise ranking @xcite , and auction theory @xcite , amongst others .",
    "however , the tropical analogues of many fundamental results in classical linear algebra remain open .",
    "commutativity of tropical matrices is one such example .",
    "classically , if @xmath16 where @xmath17 has @xmath18 distinct eigenvalues , then @xmath19 if and only if @xmath20 can be written as a polynomial in @xmath17 @xcite . moreover , if @xmath20 has @xmath18 distinct eigenvalues , then @xmath19 if and only if @xmath17 and @xmath20 are simultaneously diagonalizable . in a similar spirit",
    ", we have the following criterion for a special class of matrices called polytropes to commute tropically . here the kleene star @xmath21 of a polytrope @xmath17 is the finite geometric sum @xmath22 .    [ main_theorem ] suppose @xmath23 are polytropes .",
    "if @xmath24 , then @xmath25 . if @xmath25 , then @xmath26 .",
    "in particular , for @xmath27 , @xmath28 if and only if @xmath29 .",
    "previous works on commuting tropical matrices have also focused on polytropes @xcite , due to its special role as the projection to the tropical eigenspace @xcite . to the best of our knowledge ,",
    "this is the first necessary and sufficient characterization of commutativity for polytropes for @xmath30 .",
    "the second half of our paper looks at tropical commuting matrices from the viewpoint of tropical algebraic geometry .",
    "this is a successful young field bridging combinatorics and algebraic geometry .",
    "it has many applications ranging from curve counting , to number theory , to polyhedral geometry , to phylogenetics @xcite .",
    "we study the relation between three sets of pairs of @xmath0 matrices which all ` commute tropically ' in different sense : the _ tropical commuting set _ @xmath31 , the set of all pairs of tropical commuting matrices ; the _ tropical commuting variety _ @xmath32 , the _ tropicalization _ of the classical commuting variety ; and the _ tropical commuting prevariety _ @xmath33 , the intersection of the tropical hypersurfaces corresponding to the natural generators of classical commuting variety .",
    "in addition to the inclusion @xmath34 ( by definition ) , one can quickly see that @xmath35 .",
    "we show that in general both of these inclusions can be strict , and neither @xmath31 nor @xmath36 is contained in the other when @xmath37 .      in section [ sec : ts ] we present background , notation , and results in tropical linear algebra , and prove lemma [ lem : fixedpoint ] .",
    "we use these results to prove theorem [ main_theorem ] , and then illustrate the geometry of commuting polytropes . in section [ sec : tc ]",
    "we review basic concepts in tropical algebraic geometry , present the relationships between the spaces @xmath31 , @xmath32 , and @xmath33 , and explicitly compute these sets for @xmath38 using the software @xcite .",
    "complete description of our computations , including input files , commands and output files can be found at the public github repository http://github.com/princengoc/tropicalcommutingvariety .",
    "finally , we conclude with open problems in section [ sec : summary ] .",
    "we begin with some notation and basic facts in tropical linear algebra .",
    "see @xcite for more details .    if @xmath18 is a positive integer , let @xmath39=\\{1,2,.\\ldots n\\}$ ]",
    ". we will write tropical matrix multiplication as @xmath40 to remind the reader of the min - linear nature of the algebra .",
    "let @xmath41 denote the tropical identity matrix , with @xmath42 on the diagonal and @xmath43 elsewhere .",
    "let @xmath44 be the tropical torus .",
    "if @xmath45 is closed under scalar tropical multiplication , we shall identify it with the set in @xmath46 obtained by normalizing the first coordinate to be 0 .",
    "the image of a matrix @xmath17 , denoted @xmath47 , is an example of such a set .",
    "the _ tropical convex hull _ between two points @xmath48 is @xmath49 = \\{a \\odot x \\oplus b \\odot y : a , b \\in { \\mathbb{r}}\\}.\\ ] ] as a set in @xmath46 , this is called the tropical line segment between @xmath50 and @xmath51 .",
    "a _ tropical polytope _ , also known as tropical semi - module , is the tropical convex hull of finitely many points .",
    "the image of an @xmath10 matrix is a tropical polytope with at most @xmath18 distinct vertices in @xmath46 . for an @xmath0 matrix @xmath17 with tropical eigenvalue @xmath42 ,",
    "the _ kleene star _ of @xmath17 is the matrix @xmath52 .",
    "this is in fact equals to the finite sum @xmath53 .",
    "we can view a matrix @xmath54 as a map @xmath55 .",
    "each of the columns of @xmath17 defines a point in @xmath46 , and the image of @xmath17 is the tropical convex hull of these points .",
    "a particularly nice case is where the image is full dimensional .",
    "this leads us to the following definition .",
    "a matrix @xmath56 is a _ premetric _",
    "if @xmath57 , @xmath58 for all @xmath59 $ ] .    in this case",
    ", @xmath17 has eigenvalue @xmath42 , and its image in @xmath46 is a full - dimensional tropical simplex whose main cell has type @xmath60 in the sense of @xcite .    a matrix @xmath56 is a _ polytrope _",
    "if @xmath17 is a premetric , and for all @xmath61 $ ] , @xmath62 .",
    "there are many equivalent characterizations of polytrope , e.g. , that it is a premetric and @xmath63 , or that it is a kleene star of some matrix @xcite .",
    "a polytrope @xmath17 has eigenvalue @xmath42 , and the @xmath18 columns of @xmath17 are its @xmath18 eigenvectors . the image of @xmath17 in @xmath46 is a full - dimensional tropical polytope that is also convex in the usual euclidean sense .    for any matrix @xmath54 and @xmath64",
    ", we can consider its preimage under @xmath17 , i.e. the set of @xmath65 such that @xmath66 @xcite .",
    "if @xmath17 is a polytrope , this preimage has a simple and explicit form .",
    "we note that the following theorem is a special case of theorem 3.1.1 in @xcite , attributed to cunninghame - green ( 1960 ) and zimmerman ( 1976 ) .",
    "this result was also independently re - discovered by krivulin @xcite .",
    "[ thm : image ] let @xmath54 be a polytrope .",
    "define @xmath67 for some @xmath68 .",
    "suppose that @xmath64 has the form @xmath69 then @xmath66 if and only if @xmath70 \\backslash i}t_j\\mathsf{e}_j,\\ ] ] where @xmath71 , and @xmath72 is the unit vector on the @xmath73-th coordinate .",
    "the above theorem implies that @xmath17 is a projection of @xmath46 onto its image , which is the tropical convex hull this is illustrated in figure [ figure : polytrope_map ] for a @xmath74 polytrope with the columns in @xmath75 as dots and their tropical convex hull in grey .",
    "as the matrix acts on @xmath75 , the three columns of the matrix are fixed , as is their tropical convex hull .",
    "the remainder of the plane except for three rays is divided into three regions that are mapped in the directions @xmath76 , @xmath77 , or @xmath78 .",
    "this maps each point to an upside - down tropical line with center at one of the three columns .",
    "the rays of these lines that are not in the tropical convex hull are mapped to the point at the center of the tropical line .",
    ".,title=\"fig : \" ] [ figure : polytrope_map ]    note that @xmath25 means for each @xmath79 , the projection of the @xmath80-th column of @xmath20 onto the image of @xmath17 equals the projection of the @xmath80-th column of @xmath17 onto the image of @xmath20 .",
    "thus , theorem [ thm : image ] gives an easy geometric check if two polytropes commute .",
    "we now give explicit examples for @xmath81 , using three polytropes whose images are illustrated in figure [ figure : polytropes ] .",
    "let @xmath17 , @xmath20 , and @xmath82 have the images of their columns labelled by dots , boxes , and crosses , respectively .",
    ", title=\"fig:\",scaledwidth=37.0% ] [ figure : polytropes ]    the matrices @xmath17 and @xmath20 ( in bold ) commute .",
    "consider @xmath83 , which is a hexagon .",
    "the vertices of the hexagon are the vertices of @xmath84 ; to see this , simply map the columns of @xmath20 to @xmath47 in the natural way .",
    "similarly , the vertices of the hexagon are the vertices of @xmath85 .",
    "it follows that @xmath86 .",
    "the matrices @xmath17 and @xmath82 do not commute .",
    "the pentagon @xmath87 is _ not _",
    "@xmath88 ( or @xmath89 ) .",
    "for instance , the upper - right cross vertex is not mapped to this intersection by the action of @xmath17 .",
    "this means that @xmath17 and @xmath82 do not commute .",
    "we close this section by collecting some useful facts about premetrics .",

    "therefore , we only prove those statements .    [",

    "let @xmath3 be an algebraically closed non - archimedean field with non - trivial valuation , such as the puiseux series over @xmath145 , and fix an integer @xmath146 .",
    "let @xmath147 $ ] and let @xmath148 be the ideal generated by the @xmath4 elements of the form @xmath149 where @xmath150 .",
    "we call the variety @xmath151 the @xmath0 _ commuting variety _ over @xmath3",
    ". it is irreducible and has dimension @xmath152 @xcite .",
    "its classical points correspond to pairs of matrices @xmath153 that commute .",
    "since @xmath3 is algebraically closed , we may identify the variety with pairs of commuting matrices .",
    "the situation is more subtle tropically .",
    "as in the introduction , we consider three tropical spaces :    * the _ tropical commuting set _ @xmath31 , which is the collection of all pairs of @xmath0 tropical commuting matrices in @xmath154 . * the _ tropical commuting variety _ @xmath32 , which is the tropicalization of the commuting variety . * the _ tropical commuting prevariety _ @xmath33 , which is the tropical prevariety defined by the @xmath4 equations in ( [ classical_generators ] ) .",
    "the tropicalization of a variety over such a field can be defined as the euclidean closure of the image of the variety under coordinate - wise valuation . for completeness",
    "we recall an alternate definition of a tropical variety : for @xmath155 , @xmath156 $ ] , let @xmath157 denote the initial form of @xmath158 , @xmath159 the initial ideal of @xmath160 .",
    "the tropical variety @xmath161 is the subcomplex of the grbner fan of @xmath160 consisting of cones @xmath162 where @xmath163 does not contain a monomial .    our first result concerns the homogeneity space of @xmath161 , denoted @xmath164 this is the set of @xmath165 such that @xmath166 .",
    "in our case , this set is a subspace of dimension @xmath167 , which coincides with the lineality space of the grbner fan of @xmath160 .",
    "suppose @xmath168 . for @xmath155 , @xmath169 if and only if there exists @xmath170 and @xmath171 such that for all @xmath172 $ ] @xmath173 in particular , @xmath164 has dimension @xmath167 for @xmath168 .",
    "for @xmath174 , @xmath175 if and only if there exist @xmath176 such that @xmath177 in particular , @xmath178 has dimension @xmath179 .",
    "we shall prove that @xmath180 satisfies ( [ eqn : homog ] ) if and only if @xmath181 for all @xmath172 $ ] .",
    "since the @xmath182 s generate @xmath160 , this then implies @xmath183 .",
    "suppose @xmath180 is such that @xmath181 .",
    "for each fixed @xmath172 $ ] , the monomials @xmath184 and @xmath185 have equal weights .",
    "thus @xmath186 for all @xmath172 $ ] . similarly , @xmath187 .",
    "now , @xmath184 and @xmath188 have equal weights .",
    "thus @xmath189 consider a triple @xmath61 $ ] of distinct indices .",
    "the monomials @xmath190 and @xmath188 have equal weights .",
    "thus @xmath191 since this holds for all triples @xmath61 $ ] , we necessarily have @xmath192 for some @xmath171 .",
    "thus , @xmath180 is of the form given in ( [ eqn : homog ] ) .    finally , for @xmath174 , ( [ eqn : equal.weights1 ] ) still holds .",
    "so we have ( [ eqn : homog2 ] ) .",
    "define @xmath193 , @xmath194 , we see that @xmath178 is a linear subspace of @xmath195 of dimension 4 , parametrized by four parameters @xmath196 .      the tropical variety @xmath198 lives in an @xmath199-dimensional ambient space , corresponding to the four @xmath200 and",
    "the four @xmath201 coordinates .",
    "it is @xmath202-dimensional , with a @xmath179-dimensional lineality space .",
    "modding out by this lineality space gives a @xmath203-dimensional fan with f - vector @xmath204 meaning there are four rays and six @xmath203-dimensional cones .",
    "the tropical variety is simplicial and pure .",
    "computation with shows that the tropical prevariety equals the tropical variety .",
    "in other words , the following three polynomials @xmath205 form a tropical basis for @xmath206 .",
    "we summarize this and slightly more in the following proposition .",
    "[ proposition_2x2 ] we have @xmath207 .",
    "the homogeneity space is @xmath208    we have proven everything except the relationship between @xmath209 and the other spaces . if @xmath210 , then two of the generators of our tropical basis , namely @xmath211 and @xmath212 , are tropically satisfied . the final generator @xmath213 .",
    "is tropically satisfied if and only @xmath214 , giving the claimed equality .",
    "let @xmath215 be the field of puiseux series over @xmath216 with the usual valuation .",
    "proposition [ proposition_2x2 ] tells us when commuting @xmath197 tropical matrices with entries in @xmath217 can be lifted to commuting tropical matrices in @xmath3 . since the pair of matrices @xmath218 satisfies @xmath219 , so they can be lifted , for instance to the pair of matrices @xmath220    .,title=\"fig : \" ] [ figure : three_spaces_2 ]    the relationship between the three spaces for @xmath221 is illustrated in figure [ figure : three_spaces_2 ] .",
    "we now give an example to demonstrate that the containment @xmath222 really is proper .",
    "consider the pair of matrices @xmath223 .",
    "these commute under tropical matrix multiplication , but do not tropically satisfy the polynomial @xmath224 .",
    "thus , this pair of matrices is in @xmath209 , but not in @xmath225 .      for higher dimensions ,",
    "the containment relation between the three sets is as pictured in figure [ figure : three_spaces_n ] .",
    "we state and prove the result for @xmath81 .",
    "the proofs for cases with @xmath226 are similar .",
    "[ prop : containment ] we have @xmath227 , and neither @xmath228 nor @xmath229 are contained in one another .",
    "to see that each region in figure [ figure : three_spaces_n ] is really nonempty , consider the following examples .    *",
    "the pair of matrices @xmath230 , \\hspace{1em } b = \\left[\\begin{array}{ccc } 12 &   0 &    1 \\\\ 0 & 2 & 0 \\\\ 1 &   0 &   6 \\end{array}\\right]$ ] is in @xmath231 .",
    "indeed , direct computation shows that @xmath232 .",
    "computations with show that the initial monomial ideal with this weight vector contains the monomial @xmath233 .",
    "thus , @xmath234 does not lie in the tropical variety .",
    "the polynomial with this leading term is given by @xmath235 each of the three terms @xmath236 , @xmath237 and @xmath238 is a sum of six monomials , two of which are initial monomials .",
    "this gives 18 monomials in total with 6 initial monomials .",
    "however , the six initial monomials come in three pairs , which are cancelled out by the signs .",
    "so ( [ eqn : bad.polynomial ] ) has 12 monomials , and the weights are such that there is a unique leading term .",
    "* the pair of matrices @xmath239 , \\hspace{1em } d = \\left[\\begin{array}{ccc } 0 &   2 &    4 \\\\ 1 & 0 & 4 \\\\ 4 &   4 &   0 \\end{array}\\right]$ ] is in @xmath240 .",
    "+ indeed , direct computation shows that these matrices commute , and that containment in @xmath228 fails on the @xmath78 and the @xmath241 entries of the products .",
    "* the pair of matrices @xmath242 , \\hspace{1em } f = \\left[\\begin{array}{ccc } 1 &   0 &    3 \\\\ 0 & 1 & 0 \\\\ 1 &   0 &   3 \\end{array}\\right]$ ] is in @xmath243 .",
    "+ indeed , direct computation shows that these matrices fail to commute in the @xmath244 entry of the products , and that @xmath245 .    in summary , we have @xmath246 , @xmath247 , and @xmath248 .",
    ".,title=\"fig : \" ] [ figure : three_spaces_n ]      the tropical variety @xmath249 lives in an @xmath250-dimensional ambient space , corresponding to the nine @xmath200 and the nine @xmath201 coordinates .",
    "it is @xmath251-dimensional , with a @xmath179-dimensional lineality space .",
    "modding out gives us an @xmath199-dimensional space .",
    "the f - vector is @xmath252 which ranges from the 1658 rays to the 235,038 @xmath199-dimensional cones .",
    "the tropical variety is pure , but not simplicial .",
    "the tropical prevariety is much bigger than the tropical variety .",
    "the prevariety is neither pure nor simplicial .",
    "modulo the lineality space , its largest cones are of dimension 10 .",
    "its @xmath158-vector is @xmath253    as shown in the proof of proposition [ prop : containment ] , apart from the generators of the pre - variety , the tropical basis for @xmath249 necessary contains the polynomial @xmath254 and all of its permutations under @xmath255 , by permuting the rows and columns of the matrices simultaneously , and swapping @xmath1 and @xmath2 . by a similar argument , another set of polynomials in the tropical basis are all permutations of @xmath256 however , these two sets of polynomials alone can not account for the gap in the dimension of the maximal cones between @xmath249 and @xmath228 .",
    "we suspect that the full tropical basis of @xmath249 contains many more polynomials .",
    "computing this basis explicitly is an interesting open question .      as a first step to computing the tropical basis of @xmath249 , we study the analogue of @xmath228 and @xmath249 for pairs of commuting _ symmetric matrices _ , so that @xmath257 and @xmath258 .",
    "these live in a @xmath251-dimensional ambient space , corresponding to the six @xmath200 and the six @xmath201 coordinates .",
    "the ideal @xmath259 is generated by the following three polynomials : @xmath260    the symmetric tropical commuting variety is @xmath261-dimensional , with a @xmath203-dimensional lineality space .",
    "its f - vector is @xmath262 the symmetric tropical commuting prevariety is only one dimension bigger .",
    "it has dimension 10 , also with a @xmath203-dimensional lineality space .",
    "its @xmath158-vector is @xmath263 under the action of @xmath255 , the six cones of dimension ten form three orbits .",
    "we name them type i , ii and iii .",
    "type i has orbit size 1 , with initial monomials @xmath264 type ii has orbit size 2 , with initial monomials @xmath265 type iii has orbit size 3 , with initial monomials @xmath266 in theory , since there are three generators with six terms , there can be at most @xmath267 possible cones of the symmetric tropical commuting prevariety with maximal dimension .",
    "it remains to be understood why only the above six cones are full - dimensional .",
    "in this work we studied tropical commuting matrices from the perspectives of linear algebra and algebraic geometry .",
    "we gave algebraic and geometric conditions for @xmath10 polytropes , a special class of matrices , to commute .",
    "our conditions are necessary and sufficient for @xmath27 .",
    "we also tropicalize the classical commuting variety of @xmath10 matrices , explicitly compute them for @xmath27 , and study their relations to the tropical commuting prevariety and the tropical commuting set .",
    "two major open problems remain in dimensions @xmath168 : to find a complete characterization of the tropical commuting set , and to find a formula for the tropical basis for the tropical commuting variety .",
    "another future direction is to consider triples of pairwise - commuting @xmath0 matrices .",
    "it was shown in @xcite that the variety of triples of commuting @xmath0 matrices is irreducible for @xmath268 but reducible for @xmath269 .",
    "more generally , one can study the space @xmath270 of commuting @xmath271-tuples of @xmath0 matrices . for @xmath272 and @xmath273 ,",
    "this variety is reducible @xcite .",
    "studying the tropical analogues of these spaces would be a natural generalization of the work we have done here .",
    "+ we thank jm landsberg , laura matusevich , and bernd sturmfels for guidance and advice throughout this project .",
    "ralph morrison was supported by the us national science foundation .",
    "ngoc tran was supported by the simons foundation ( @xmath274 to the university of texas at austin ) ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we study tropical commuting matrices from two viewpoints : linear algebra and algebraic geometry . in classical linear algebra , there exist various criteria to test whether two square matrices commute . </S>",
    "<S> we ask for similar criteria in the realm of tropical linear algebra , giving conditions for two tropical matrices that are polytropes to commute . from the algebro - geometric perspective </S>",
    "<S> , we explicitly compute the tropicalization of the classical variety of commuting matrices in dimension 2 and 3 . </S>"
  ]
}
